SourceText: Today’s parenting skill is about helping your child know how to learn from their mistakes. 💚
text:
孩子能从错误中学到知识吗❓答案是，当然可以！

这就叫“汲错成智”！💚

SourceText: Learning from our mistakes can help us avoid them in the future. 🌷
text: 从错误中吸取经验，可以避免未来犯同样的错。🌷

SourceText: It can also help us be more supportive to ourselves and less harsh when things do not go well. 😃
text: 也让我们对自己更宽容，在事情不顺利时不要太苛责自己。😃

SourceText: True or False: If my child understands their mistake and says sorry, that means I can bring up other mistakes they have made so that they learn.
text: 如果孩子知错，并且道歉了，那我应该再趁机说一说他们犯过的其他错误，让他们好好反省。

SourceText: ✨ Your child probably feels very bad about making a mistake. Praise them for apologising and show that you are proud of them. 💙
text: ✨ 孩子犯了错，可能已经很难过了💔如果他们真心道歉，请表扬他们，勇于承认错误也值得骄傲。💙

SourceText: 😔 Your child may be tempted to hide mistakes from you out of fear if they feel unsupported.
text: 😔 如果继续批评孩子，下次孩子可能会因为害怕受批评，而隐瞒错误。

SourceText: ✨ Your child probably feels very bad about making a mistake. Praise them for apologising and show that you are proud of them for realising and saying sorry. 💙
text: ✨ 孩子犯了错，可能已经很难过了💔如果他们真心道歉，请表扬他们，勇于承认错误也值得骄傲。💙

SourceText: {F3_DAUGHTER_4} is getting a bit too active indoors, today. Let’s see how her uncle, {F3_UNCLE}, reacts:
text: {F3_DAUGHTER_4}打碎花瓶了，让我们看看她叔叔{F3_UNCLE}是怎么做的：

SourceText: 4️⃣ Here are four tips that you can use to help your child learn from their mistakes:
text:
孩子犯了错，如何像漫画里的叔叔一样妥善地处理呢？

4️⃣个小妙招，错误也有大用处！

SourceText: 1️⃣ TALK
text: 1️⃣ 聊一聊

SourceText: 👂 Create space and time for your child to talk with you about their life.
text: 👂 给孩子创造时间和空间，让他们能够与你谈论他们的生活。

SourceText: 💙 If their day was challenging, listen to them, and give space to let them share.
text: 💙 如果他们哪天过得不太好，给他们点空间，让他们自由分享，你也要认真倾听。

SourceText: 💛 Give them support and show you care. Tell them, "that sounds difficult.”
text: 💛 给予他们关心和支持，积极回应，让他们知道你在认真听。

SourceText: 2️⃣ PRAISE EFFORT
text: 2️⃣ 表扬孩子的努力

SourceText: 💛 Praise your child for the effort they put into their learning even if they did not succeed.
text: 💛 不管孩子成功与否，都要赞扬孩子所付出的努力。

SourceText: ✨ Effort is more important than mastering a specific skill.
text: ✨ 努力比成功更重要。

SourceText: 3️⃣ ALLOW FOR MISTAKES TO HAPPEN
text: 3️⃣ 允许错误的发生

SourceText: 🌱 Allow your child to make mistakes. Let them learn from their own mistakes so they can learn and grow.
text: 🌱 允许你的孩子犯错误。让他们从自己的错误中吸取教训，这样他们才能学习和成长。

SourceText: ❓ You may want to solve every problem for your child, especially when you know better. But this will not teach them to solve their own problems.
text: ❓ 你可能想替孩子解决每一个问题，尤其是在某些事上你更有经验的时候。但这样做并不能让他们学会自己解决问题。

SourceText: 😃 Talk to your child about their mistakes and allow them to figure out a way to solve their problems and do better next time.
text: 😃 跟孩子聊聊他们的错误，让他们想办法自己解决问题，并试着在下次做得更好。

SourceText: 📖 Try and share your own failures with your child and discuss how they helped you develop and grow.
text: 📖 试着与你的孩子分享你自己的失败经历，并说说这些经历是怎样帮助你进步和成长的。

SourceText: ✅This helps your child learn that you do not have to be perfect all the time.
text: ✅这可以让你的孩子知道，并非每次都要完美无缺。

SourceText: Home activity! ⭐Share a story with your child about a time you learned from a mistake. It can be something from when you were a child yourself or another life lesson.
text:
家庭练习！⭐

跟孩子分享你从错误中吸取经验的故事，可以是你小时候的事，也可以是生活中的其他经验教训。💡

SourceText: Do you have time to do it today? ⏰
text: 今天有时间试一试吗？⏰

SourceText: True or False: All children develop at the same speed as each other.
text: 所有儿童都以同样的速度发展。

SourceText: ❌ That is incorrect.
text: ❌ 不对哦。

SourceText: ✨ Each child is unique and will develop at their own pace. Some children may develop in some ways faster than others, while some may take more time.
text: ✨ 每个孩子的发育节奏不同。

SourceText: 💚 It is important that parents are patient and supportive, recognizing that every child has their own individual path of development.
text: 💚请对孩子多些耐心和鼓励。

SourceText: ❗Remember that issues with your child’s development are not always obvious, and your child’s condition is NOT your fault.
🚩 If you have concerns about your child's development, you should consult with a professional to get support and advice.
text: 🚩 如果你对你孩子的发展有疑虑的话，请尽快寻求专业人士的支持和建议。

SourceText: ✅Correct!
text: ✅答对了！

SourceText: 3️⃣ To support the healthy development of @fields.child_nickname, use these 3 tips:

SourceText: 3️⃣ To support the healthy development of your child, use these 3 tips:
text: 3️⃣个小妙招，促进 孩子的健康发展！

SourceText: 1️⃣ BE PATIENT
text: 1️⃣ 保持耐心

SourceText: ⏰ Be patient while they learn new things. They may struggle at first, but with time and practice they will succeed.
text: ⏰ 当孩子学习新东西时，你需要有耐心。他们一开始可能会遇到困难，但是随着时间的推移和不断地练习，他们终会成功。

SourceText: ⭐ You can also support them by helping them break large tasks into smaller tasks and with words of encouragement.
text: ⭐ 你也可以帮他们将一个大任务分解为几个小任务，这样任务就变得更简单了。并多鼓励他们，来给他们提供支持。

SourceText: 🌷 @fields.child_nickname may express feelings dramatically. This is OK! In time, @fields.child_nickname will learn to manage their emotions.
text: 🌷 @fields.child_nickname 可能很容易情绪化，这没关系，随着时间的推移， @fields.child_nickname 将学会如何管理自己的情绪。
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: 🌷 your child may express feelings dramatically. This is OK! In time, your child will learn to manage their emotions.
text: 🌷你的孩子可能很容易情绪化，失败时会感到很难过。但这没关系，随着时间的推移，他们将慢慢学会如何管理自己的情绪。

SourceText: 2️⃣ EXPLORE SAFELY
text: 2️⃣ 安全地探索

SourceText: 🚲 @fields.child_nickname will become more curious and do more by themselves as they observe the world around them. Be aware of their activities, but encourage them to safely experience fun activities!
text: 🚲随着 @fields.child_nickname 对周围世界观察的深入，他们会变得更好奇，也会自己去做更多的尝试。你要做的是注意他们的举动，鼓励他们安全地体验各种有趣的事情！
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: 🌱 If @fields.child_nickname wants to do tasks on their own, such as tying their own shoelaces or combing their own hair, you can teach them and help them do it safely.
text: 🌱 如果 @fields.child_nickname 想自己做一些事情，比如自己系鞋带或者梳头，你可以教他们。你的任务就是在他们学习独立的过程中，保障他们的安全。

SourceText: 🚲 your child will become more curious and do more by themselves as they observe the world around them. Be aware of their activities, but encourage them to safely experience fun activities!

SourceText: 🌱 If your child wants to do tasks on their own, such as tying their own shoelaces or combing their own hair, you can teach them and help them do it safely.

SourceText: ▶️Press play to learn 3️⃣ three tips for managing your stress
text: 缓解压力只需3️⃣步:

SourceText: 3️⃣ Here are three steps to help you manage your stress:
text: 缓解压力只需3️⃣步:

SourceText: 1️⃣ REFLECT
text: 1️⃣认识自己

SourceText: 📝 Grab a pen and piece of paper.
text: 📝拿出一支笔和一张纸。

SourceText: ⏸ Take a moment to think about how much stress you are feeling.
text: ⏸ 花点时间想想你觉得自己目前压力有多大。

SourceText: ⭐ Write down from 0 to 100 how stressed you are.
text: ⭐ 从1到100中选一个数，来表示你感受到的压力强度。数字越大表示压力越大。

SourceText: ❓ How does stress feel for you? Do you feel tense, do you have low energy? Are you finding it hard to sleep and focus, or like everything is too much? Write these down.
text: ❓压力对你来说是什么感觉？你感觉紧张吗？你觉得疲惫吗？你会失眠、无法集中注意力，还是觉得事事都很难？把这些写下来。

SourceText: 🌱 Knowing how your body responds to stress can help you manage it.
text: 🌱了解自己身体对压力的反应，可以帮助你缓解压力。

SourceText: 2️⃣ IDENTIFY
text: 2️⃣识别和管理压力源

SourceText: 🚩 Write down the main stressors in your life.
text: 🚩 写下你生活中主要的压力来源。

SourceText: 💡 Knowing why you feel stress can help you address the stressor and learn how to cope and manage it.
text: 💡 了解自己为什么感受到压力，可以帮助你面对压力源，并学会如何应对和管理它。

SourceText: 🎨 Now identify what activities make you happy. What do you enjoy doing?
text: 🎨 现在，想一想哪些活动能让你感到快乐。你喜欢做什么？

SourceText: 💚 There are different things you can do to care for yourself, such as walking, singing, and reading. Activities that help you manage stress are called ‘self-care.’
text: 💚 做一些让你感到放松的事情，比如散步、唱歌或阅读。这些能够帮助你缓解压力的活动就是“善待自己”。

SourceText: 3️⃣ ROUTINE
text: 3️⃣改善日常安排

SourceText: ✨ Reflect on your daily life: how can you reduce your stress?
text: ✨ 回顾你的日常生活，想一想：怎么做能减轻压力？

SourceText: ☕ How many self-care activities can you fit in your routine?
text: ☕ 在你的日常生活中，能安排多少用来善待自己的活动？

SourceText: ⏰ Try and make time for at least one self-care activity a day.
text: ⏰ 试着每天抽出时间做至少一件善待自己的事。

SourceText: Home Activity! Write down a list of activities that you can do for yourself that bring you joy. They can be something simple like going for a walk or chatting with a friend. 💚
text:
家庭练习！⭐

列个单子，记下让你开心的事，比如散步或聊天。💚

SourceText: That’s great! The happier and better you feel, the better parent you will be.
text: 太棒了！心情愉悦，能让你成为更好的家长。

SourceText: That’s okay. Try to do it soon. The happier and better you feel, the better parent you will be.
text: 没关系，你可以找个时间试一试。心情愉悦，能让你成为更好的家长。

SourceText: Today’s skill is all about how to help your child follow instructions. 😃
text: 3️⃣个小技巧，轻松让孩子听从指令。😃

SourceText: Even the best behaved children only follow instructions about 50% of the time. ⏰
text: 每个孩子都有不听话的时候。⏰

SourceText: Being more effective about how we give instructions can make things more peaceful and calm at home. 🌱
text: 有效地传达指令，能减少亲子冲突，让家里更和谐。🌱

SourceText: True or false: It does not matter whether you give an instruction in a positive or negative way.
text: 以积极还是消极的方式给出指令，不重要。

SourceText: Children are more likely to follow an instruction when it is worded in a positive way.
text: 孩子更容易听从积极、正面的指令。

SourceText: 💙 Negative instructions like, “Don’t do that!” can make children (and us) feel bad 😣
text: 💙 负面的指令会让人感到不舒服，比如“不准这么做！”😣

SourceText: {F3_DAUGTHER_4} is playing with the handphone on the floor.
text: 如何发出积极指令？让我们看看，妈妈是怎么让 {F3_DAUGTHER_4} 停止玩手机，准备上床睡觉的。

SourceText: ▶️ This video teaches you 3️⃣ three tips to help your child follow instructions more often
text:
如何才能像漫画中的妈妈一样，让孩子乐于听从你的指令呢？

▶️ 看视频，学习3️⃣个小窍门，让孩子从此不再抗拒指令！

SourceText: ▶️ This audio message teaches you 3️⃣ three tips to help your child follow instructions more often
text:
如何才能像漫画中的妈妈一样，让孩子乐于听从你的指令呢？

▶️ 听音频，学习3️⃣个小窍门，让孩子从此不再抗拒指令！

SourceText: 1️⃣ BE SPECIFIC
text: 1️⃣ 明确具体

SourceText: ⭐Say the behaviour you want your child to do. For example: “Please take your shoes off when you come inside, Adam.”
text: ⭐说出你想让孩子做的行为。例如：“晨晨，进来时请脱掉鞋子。”

SourceText: 👀Use your child’s name to get your child’s attention. Go down to their level. Get their eye contact.
text: 👀 叫孩子的名字来引起他们的注意。蹲下来，跟他们保持同一高度。注意要有眼神交流。

SourceText: 2️⃣ BE REALISTIC
text: 2️⃣ 现实可行

SourceText: ⭐Make sure that the instruction is something that your child can do.
text: ⭐确保这项指令是你孩子有能力完成的。

SourceText: 💡Give one instruction at a time. It can be difficult for your child to remember many instructions!
text: 💡每次只给一个指令，因为孩子很难同时记住很多个指令！

SourceText: ⏰If possible, give a transition warning: “In 3 minutes, it will be bedtime and you will need to give the cellphone back to me.”
text: ⏰ 在过渡到另一项活动之前，尽可能给孩子一个提示，比如：“3分钟后就到睡觉时间了，你要把手机还给我。”

SourceText: 3️⃣ BE POSITIVE
text: 3️⃣ 积极正面

SourceText: ⭐Use positive words when giving instructions. For example, instead of “Don’t shout,” say “Talk in a quiet voice.”
text: ⭐在给出指令时，尽量使用积极正面的词语。例如，与其说“不要大喊大叫”，不如说“说话小声一点”。

SourceText: 💡Give instructions in a firm voice and stay calm. Behave as if you expect your child to do what you ask.
text: 💡给出指令时，语气要坚定，并且冷静。让孩子知道他们必须按要求去做，不容分说。

SourceText: 🎁Praise, praise, praise! Make sure you praise your child immediately when they follow your instruction.
text: 🎁夸奖、夸奖、夸奖！当孩子遵从了你的指令时，记得夸夸他们。

SourceText: 🌷Also, be kind to yourself if you forget sometimes. Learning how to give positive instructions is not easy, but it works! 💙
text: 🌷如果你有时候忘记这些步骤了，那也没关系，对自己宽容点，慢慢来。学习如何给出积极的指令并不容易，但一旦学会了，将非常受用！💙

SourceText: Home activity! ⭐Try to give specific, realistic, and positive instructions with your child. Do you have time to do this today? ⏰

SourceText: 2️⃣ KEEP IT REAL
text: 2️⃣ 确保规则可行

SourceText: ⭐ Make rules realistic: What can @fields.child_nickname actually do?
text: ⭐想一想： @fields.child_nickname 有能力做到什么？
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: 📖 Be clear and specific about what you want them to do.
text: 📖清晰准确地说明你想让他们做什么。

SourceText: ✅ Make sure the rule is fair. Explain the reason for the rule.
text: ✅确保规则的公平性。给孩子们解释下制定规则的原因。

SourceText: ⭐ Make rules realistic: What can your child actually do?
text: ⭐想一想：孩子有能力做到什么？

SourceText: 4️⃣ PRAISE, PRAISE, PRAISE
⭐ Praise @fields.child_nickname for setting a family rule with you.
text: 🎈 如果 @fields.child_nickname 参与制定了日常作息，记得夸夸孩子。
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: 😃 Praise @fields.child_nickname when they follow the rule, just like you do when they behave well!
text: 😃如果 @fields.child_nickname 遵守规则，表现良好，也要记得表扬他们！
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: ⭐ Praise your child for setting a family rule with you.
text: ⭐如果孩子参与制定了家庭规则，记得夸夸他们！

SourceText: 😃 Praise your child when they follow the rule, just like you do when they behave well!
text: 😃如果孩子遵守规则，表现良好，也要记得表扬他们！

SourceText: Create at least one family rule with @fields.child_nickname.📝
text:
家庭练习！⭐

与 @fields.child_nickname 一起制定至少一条家庭规则，比如规定每天能看多久的电视。📝
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Create at least one family rule with your child.📝
text:
家庭练习！⭐

与孩子一起制定至少一条家庭规则，比如规定每天能看多久的电视。📝

SourceText: That's great to hear! Create one family rule with @fields.child_nickname today. Remember, when you involve @fields.child_nickname in making rules, they are more likely to follow them. It's a recipe for success! 🏆
text: 太好了！今天就和 @fields.child_nickname 一起制定一条家庭规则吧。记住，如果让 @fields.child_nickname 参与制定，他们就更可能遵守规则！🏆
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: That's great to hear! Create one family rule with your child today. Remember, when you involve your child in making rules, they are more likely to follow them. It's a recipe for success! 🏆
text: 太好了！今天就和孩子一起制定一条家庭规则吧。记住，如果让孩子参与制定，他们就更可能遵守规则！🏆

SourceText: That's OK! Setting rules takes time and practice. ⏰ Think about the rules you would like to set and, when you feel more confident, talk about these rules with @fields.child_nickname. 👂 Remember, you can always review this skill in the Main Menu!
text:
没关系！学会制定家庭规则需要时间和练习。⏰

先想想你希望制定的家庭规则，当你觉得准备好了，再和 @fields.child_nickname 一起讨论。👂

别忘了，你可以随时在主菜单中复习这项技能！
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: That's OK! Setting rules takes time and practice. ⏰ Think about the rules you would like to set and, when you feel more confident, talk about these rules with your child. 👂 Remember, you can always review this skill in the Main Menu!
text:
没关系！学会制定家庭规则需要时间和练习。⏰

先想想你希望制定的家庭规则，当你觉得准备好了，再和孩子一起讨论。👂

别忘了，你可以随时在主菜单中复习这项技能！

SourceText: Caregivers and children all have a role to play in the household. 📝
text:
你想过吗，在家里，家长和孩子各自的责任是什么？

每个人都有自己的家庭责任。📝

SourceText: Your child’s role is to listen to and learn from their caregivers. They can also start doing chores appropriate for their age. ⭐
text: 作为孩子，他们要听从家长的教诲，也可以开始做些家务活，培养劳动观念。⭐

SourceText: As a caregiver, your role is to care for your child, keep them safe, and teach them how to behave in the world. 🌱
text: 作为家长，你要照顾孩子，确保他们安全，教他们正确行事。🌱

SourceText: Your most important role is to help your child feel loved and supported, no matter what! 💙
text: 最重要的是，💙让孩子感受到爱和支持！💙

SourceText: If your child feels loved and supported at home, they are more likely to happily do chores and to grow into a healthy child and adult! 😃💚
text:
孩子在家里感受到被爱和支持，会更乐意帮家长忙。💚
同时，也会成长地更健康！😃

SourceText: True or False: If I make a mistake or do something that upsets my child, I should pretend it didn’t happen, smile at them, and do a more positive activity with them.
text: 如果我犯了错，或做了让孩子不高兴的事情，我应该假装什么都没有发生，一笑而过，做点别的事转移孩子的注意力。

SourceText: ❌ That’s not right.
text: ❌不对哦。

SourceText: 💛 Admitting mistakes and apologising teaches them to respect others and that it is okay to get things wrong sometimes.
text: 💛承认错误和主动道歉，能教会孩子尊重他人，也让他们知道犯错是正常的。

SourceText: ❗ Ignoring a mistake when it affects your child teaches them that they do not need to take responsibility for their actions.
text: ❗ 如果故意无视错误，会让他们觉得人不用为自己的行为负责。

SourceText: 🏆 Correct!
text: 🏆答对了！

SourceText: ▶️ Press play to watch a video message about everyone’s role in the home. 💡
text: 4️⃣条小贴士，感知家庭中的爱与责任，了解家长和孩子的责任。💡

SourceText: ▶️ Press play to hear a message about everyone’s role in the home. 💡
text: 4️⃣条小贴士，感知家庭中的爱与责任，了解家长和孩子的责任。💡

SourceText: 4️⃣ Here are four tips to help you know what your role is as your child’s caregiver and to teach them their role, too.
text: 通过4️⃣条小贴士，感知家庭中的爱与责任，了解家长和孩子的责任。

SourceText: 3️⃣ DO AS I DO
text: 3️⃣ 榜样的力量

SourceText: 👀 Your child will learn from your actions much more than from the words you tell them. They notice more than you might think!
text: 👀 比起你的言语，孩子会从你的行动中学到更多的东西。你的一举一动他们都看在眼里！

SourceText: 🌷 Treat your child and those around you in the way you would want your child to act: with respect, kindness, patience, and love.
text: 🌷 你希望孩子怎么对待他人，你就可以怎么对待孩子和你周围的人——带着尊重、善良、耐心和爱。

SourceText: ❌ Shouting at or hitting your child will only teach them to hit others when they are upset.
text: ❌ 大声斥责孩子或打孩子，只能让他们学会在自己不顺心时，去伤害他人。

SourceText: 💚 Talk to them calmly and set a clear consequence so they learn to be calm with themselves and with others. You’ll learn more about consequences in the next goal.
text: 💚 冷静下来，与他们交谈，并为问题行为设定一个明确的“后果”。这样还能教会他们遇事要冷静。在”改善儿童行为问题“的目标模块中，你也将了解如何设定“后果”。

SourceText: Skill complete! You have learnt about the roles you and your family members have at home.
text: 达成新技能！你已经了解了，父母和孩子各自在家庭中的责任。

SourceText: You have completed @(fields.c_n_mod_compl +1) out of @fields.c_n_mod skills towards your goal, Give My Child Structure ⭐.
text: 你已经完成了本目标 @fields.c_n_mod 项技能中的 @(fields.c_n_mod_compl +1) 项，正朝着你的目标“营造良好养育环境”大步迈进。⭐
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated. @results.n_skills_week and results.n_skills are numbers

SourceText: 1️⃣ KNOW YOUR ROLE
text: 1️⃣ 了解你的责任

SourceText: As a caregiver, your role is to make sure @fields.child_nickname:
text: 作为家长，你的职责是要确保 @fields.child_nickname ：
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: 🔷 has enough healthy food,
text: 🔷有充足的、有营养的食物，

SourceText: 🔷 has the clothes they need,
text: 🔷有他们需要的衣服，

SourceText: 🔷 stays safe from harm,
text: 🔷远离危险和伤害，

SourceText: 🔷 contributes to family needs, like doing chores,
text: 🔷为家庭做出力所能及的贡献，比如做家务，

SourceText: 🔷 learns the morals and values you wish them to, such as honesty,
text: 🔷养成你希望他们拥有的良好道德品质，比如诚实守信、尊老爱幼、热爱祖国，

SourceText: 🔷 has opportunities to express themselves,
text: 🔷有机会表达自己，

SourceText: 🔷 has opportunities to play, and
text: 🔷有机会玩，

SourceText: 🔷 feels loved and supported, no matter what.
text: 🔷无论发生什么，都能感受到被爱和支持。

SourceText: As a caregiver, your role is to make sure your child:
text: 作为家长，你的职责是确保孩子：

SourceText: Tell @fields.child_nickname what their role in the family is. This can include:
text: 告诉 @fields.child_nickname 他们在家庭中的职责。这可能包括：
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: 🔶 doing age-appropriate chores, like putting their toys away, making their beds, and sort laundry
text: 🔶做他们力所能及的家务，比如收拾玩具，整理床铺，把衣服分类，

SourceText: 🔶 listening when their caregivers ask something of them
text: 🔶听从家长的要求，

SourceText: 🔶 being respectful to others in the family
text: 🔶尊重家庭中的其他人。

SourceText: Tell your child what their role in the family is. This can include:
text: 告诉孩子他们在家庭中的职责。这可能包括：

SourceText: 4️⃣ NOTICE
text: 4️⃣ 关注

SourceText: 🎨 Notice what your child enjoys doing, and help them do more of it.
text: 🎨了解孩子的喜好，支持他们多做自己喜欢的事。

SourceText: ✨ If @fields.child_nickname feels as if their needs and interests are respected, they are more likely to willingly do their chores in the home!
text: ✨如果 @fields.child_nickname 觉得自己的需求和兴趣爱好受到了尊重，就可能更乐意为家庭做贡献，例如帮忙做家务，从而树立劳动观！
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: 🎁 Notice and praise them when they do the tasks that are their responsibility so they learn what is expected of them. This way, they are more likely to do it again.
text: 🎁当他们完成自己分内的任务时，及时关注并表扬他们，这样他们就会知道，你对他们的期望是什么。如此一来，下次他们就更有可能好好表现。

SourceText: ✨ If your child feels as if their needs and interests are respected, they are more likely to willingly do their chores in the home!
text: ✨如果孩子觉得自己的需求和兴趣爱好受到了尊重，就可能更乐意为家庭做贡献，例如帮忙做家务，从而树立劳动观！

SourceText: Home activity! ⭐ Talk to @fields.child_nickname about one of their interests or something they love doing and show them you love and support them for their passion. This shows them they are a valued member of your home. 💛 Do you have time to do it today?
text:
家庭练习！⭐

与 @fields.child_nickname 聊聊喜好，向孩子表达你的欣赏和支持。这能让孩子感到被重视。💛

你今天有时间试一试吗？
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Home activity! ⭐ Talk to your child about one of their interests or something they love doing and show them you love and support them for their passion. This shows them they are a valued member of your home. 💛 Do you have time to do it today?
text:
家庭练习！⭐ 

与孩子聊聊喜好，向孩子表达你的欣赏和支持。这能让孩子感到被重视。💛

你今天有时间试一试吗？

SourceText: Great! 💙 This will help @fields.child_nickname feel loved and supported, which can lead to better behaviour.
text: 真棒！💙这会让 @fields.child_nickname 感受到被爱和支持，孩子的表现就会越来越好。
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Great! 💙 This will help your child feel loved and supported, which can lead to better behaviour.
text: 真棒！💙这会让孩子感受到被爱和支持，孩子的表现就会越来越好。

SourceText: That's OK! If you don't have time today, set some time aside tomorrow. Talking to @fields.child_nickname about something they like helps them feel loved and supported, which can lead to better behaviour!
text: 没关系！今天没时间，那就明天试试。与 @fields.child_nickname 谈论喜好，会让孩子感受到被爱和支持，这还可以让孩子表现得更好！
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: That's OK! If you don't have time today, set some time aside tomorrow. Talking to your child about something they like helps them feel loved and supported, which can lead to better behaviour!
text: 没关系！今天没时间，那就明天试试。与孩子谈论他们的喜好，会让他们感受到被爱和支持，这还可以让他们表现得更好！

SourceText: Today we are going to learn about what to do when our children misbehave. 🚩
text: 孩子争吵打闹、撒泼耍赖……实在令人头疼！🚩

SourceText: It is normal for children to misbehave sometimes when they are tired, scared, hungry, learning independence, wanting something, or avoiding a task. 😒😔😣
text: 行为问题是很常见的，家长该怎么办呢？😒😔😣

SourceText: One thing we can do is stop it before it starts.We call this Redirecting Behaviours.
text:
处理行为问题的时机很重要，越早处理效果越好。

首先，你可以试试“转移注意力”。😉

SourceText: True or False: You can use redirect at any time, even when your child is already behaving badly like having a tantrum.
text: 你可以在任何时候转移注意力，即使孩子已经表现得不好了，比如已经在发脾气了。

SourceText: ➡️ Redirecting your child’s behaviour only works either before the behaviour begins or at the beginning of the behaviour (before it gets worse).
text: ➡️转移注意力在问题刚出现时最有效。

SourceText: 🙂 We will learn about what we can do if your child is already behaving badly in the next 2 modules.
text: 🙂后续我们也将学习，如何应对已经出现的行为问题。

SourceText: Let’s explore a comic illustrating how {F2_GRANDFATHER} shifts his grandchildren’s attention from negative to positive behaviors.
text: 让我们看看，{F2_GRANDFATHER}是如何把孩子的注意力，从问题行为转移到积极行为上的。

SourceText: ▶️ Press play to learn 4️⃣ tips for redirecting your child's behaviour.
text:
如何像漫画里的爷爷一样，引导孩子呢？

4️⃣个小贴士，看看如何转移孩子注意力，“防患于未然”！

SourceText: 4️⃣ There are four steps to redirecting behaviour: BE CALM, QUICK, CLEAR, and POSITIVE.
text: 转移注意力分为4️⃣步：保持冷静、迅速转移注意力、明确指令和保持积极

SourceText: Home Activity! Share these four steps with another member of your family. Sharing these skills will be great for everyone’s well being. ➡️
text:
家庭练习！⭐

和其他家庭成员分享转移注意力的要点。➡️

SourceText: Can you share these tips today?
text: 你今天可以试一试吗？

SourceText: Amazing! ✨
text: 真棒！转移注意是改善孩子行为问题最有用的技巧之一。✨

SourceText: That's OK! Sometimes it takes time to share a new parenting skill. You can always review this skill in the Main Menu! 📝
text: 没关系！有时候分享育儿技能需要时间。你可以随时在主菜单中复习此项技能！📝

SourceText: Redirecting Behaviours can help focus @fields.child_nickname’s attention from negative to positive behaviours. 😣➡️😃
text: 转移注意力，就是把  @fields.child_nickname 的注意力，从消极行为转到积极行为上来。😣➡️😃
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: For example, when @fields.child_nickname begins to whine, you can redirect their attention towards something positive like helping out with an activity. 🌱🎨
text: 比如，当 @fields.child_nickname 开始抱怨时，可以引导孩子做点积极正面的事，比如帮你拿个东西。🌱🎨
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Redirecting Behaviours can help focus your child’s attention from negative to positive behaviours. 😣➡️😃
text: 转移注意力，就是把孩子的注意力，从消极行为转到积极行为上来。😣➡️😃

SourceText: For example, when your child begins to whine, you can redirect their attention towards something positive like helping out with an activity. 🌱🎨
text: 比如，当孩子开始抱怨时，可以引导他们做点积极正面的事，比如帮你拿个东西。🌱🎨

SourceText: 1️⃣ BE CALM
text: 1️⃣ 保持冷静

SourceText: ✅ Take a few breaths before asking @fields.child_nickname to do something else.
text: ✅ 在让 @fields.child_nickname 做其他事情前，你可以自己先稍作停顿，或者深呼吸几次，保持冷静。
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: ✅ Speak with a calm voice.
text: ✅ 心平气和地跟孩子说话。

SourceText: ✅ Take a few breaths before asking your child to do something else.
text: ✅ 在让孩子做其他事情前，你可以自己先稍作停顿，或者深呼吸几次，保持冷静。

SourceText: 2️⃣ BE QUICK
text: 2️⃣ 迅速转移注意力

SourceText: ⏰ Ask @fields.child_nickname to do something else, distract them, before the behaviour begins or gets worse.
text: ⏰在行为问题刚刚开始，或者变得更糟之前，让 @fields.child_nickname 做点别的，分散他们的注意力。
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: 💡 This is much easier than using consequences after they do something!
text: 💡这比让孩子承担犯错的“后果”要容易得多！

SourceText: ⏰ Ask your child to do something else, distract them, before the behaviour begins or gets worse.
text: ⏰在行为问题刚刚开始，或者变得更糟之前，让孩子做点别的，分散他们的注意力。

SourceText: 3️⃣ BE CLEAR
text: 3️⃣ 明确指令

SourceText: ✅ Rather than saying what you DON’T like or want, tell @fields.child_nickname what you DO want them to do.
text: ✅与其说你“不喜欢”或“不想要”孩子做什么，不如告诉 @fields.child_nickname ，你想要他们做什么。
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: For example, say:
text: 比如，你可以说：

SourceText: 👂 “Please speak more softly.”
text: 👂“说话请小声一些。”

SourceText: 🍚 “Remember to wash your hands before eating.”
text: 🍚"记得在饭前洗手。"

SourceText: This way, it is easier for them to follow! ⭐
text: 这样，他们也能更容易照着做！⭐

SourceText: ✅ Rather than saying what you DON’T like or want, tell your child what you DO want them to do.
text: ✅与其说你“不喜欢”或“不想要”孩子做什么，不如告诉孩子，你想要他们做什么。

SourceText: 4️⃣ BE POSITIVE
text: 4️⃣ 保持积极

SourceText: 💚 Use positive words. Say “Come and help me plant these flowers ,” instead of saying, “Stop fighting.”.
text: 💚和孩子说话时多用积极的言语。比如说“来帮我种花吧”，而不是说“别打架了”。

SourceText: ⭐ Praise @fields.child_nickname when they behave well!
text: ⭐当 @fields.child_nickname 表现好时，要表扬他们！
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: 💙 It will also help them know what you expect from them!
text: 💙这也会让他们了解你的期望。

SourceText: ⭐ Praise your child when they behave well!
text: ⭐当孩子表现好时，要表扬他们！

SourceText: Well done! 🎉 You have learnt how to redirect the behaviour of @fields.child_nickname!
text: 很棒！🎉你已经了解了如何转移 @fields.child_nickname 的注意力，从而预防和改善孩子的行为问题！
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: You have completed @(fields.c_n_mod_compl +1) out of @fields.c_n_mod skills towards your goal, Manage My Child’s Behaviour. 🏆
text: 你已经完成了本目标 @fields.c_n_mod 项技能中的 @(fields.c_n_mod_compl +1) 项，正朝着你的目标“改善儿童行为问题”大步迈进。⭐
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated. @results.n_skills_week and results.n_skills are numbers

SourceText: Well done! 🎉 You have learnt how to redirect the behaviour of your child!
text: 很棒！🎉你已经了解了如何转移孩子的注意力，从而预防和改善孩子的行为问题！

SourceText: This skill is about what to do when children are seeking attention with demanding and negative behaviours. 🚩
text: ❓孩子闹脾气、寻求关注，该如何巧妙应对？🚩

SourceText: Children need attention from very early in their lives. 💛
text: 孩子出生起，就需要关注。💛

SourceText: Did you know that attention is a powerful reward for most children, particularly when they are young? 🎁
text: 对大多数孩子来说，家长的关注本身就是一种奖励。🎁

SourceText: It’s a great way to help them feel good about themselves. They are more likely to do as they are asked! 🔄
text: 关注能让孩子感到自己很重要，从而更自信、更听话！🔄

SourceText: True or False: You should give your child what they want when they are whining about something or having a tantrum.
text: 当孩子发脾气、哭闹时，他们想要什么你就应该给什么。

SourceText: Giving your child attention when they are whining or having a tantrum will only make it worse.
Your child will learn that they get rewarded with attention (even negative attention) when they behave that way.
text: 孩子哭闹时关注他们，会让他们觉得这样能达到目的。

SourceText: Instead, try to give your child plenty of positive attention when they behave positively (like accepting when you say they cannot have something they want).
text: 相反，应该在孩子表现好的时候，及时给予积极的关注。😉比如，你告诉他们不能买一个玩具，他们能坦然接受的时候，夸夸他们！😄

SourceText: Here is another True/False question: It is okay to give into your child if they continue to whine or have a tantrum.
text: 再来一道：如果孩子还是继续发脾气、哭闹，你就可以让步了。

SourceText: If you give in to your child, they will learn that they get their way only when they persist or make their behaviour even worse.
text: 向孩子让步，他们会学到通过哭闹来得到想要的东西。😦

SourceText: Try to stay calm and ignore your child’s behaviour even though it is very difficult.
text: 相反，试试保持冷静，选择性地对孩子的行为问题不予理睬😊加油！

SourceText: Last one! True or False: You should ignore your child even after they stop their demanding behaviour. It is the only way for them to learn their lesson.
text: 最后一道判断题：即使孩子不再哭闹了，你也不应该搭理他们，这才能让他们吸取教训。

SourceText: 💚 After showing demanding behaviour, your child will need love and care. It was difficult for them too. Take deep breaths and praise them for changing to a more positive behaviour.
text: 💚在哭闹之后，孩子非常需要你的关爱。哭闹对他们来说也不好受。你可以试着深呼吸，然后针对停止哭闹这件事情，给予他们表扬。

SourceText: ❗ Ignoring your child is never a good idea! You can ignore negative behaviour, but never your child.
text: ❗ 我们忽略的是孩子的某个行为，而不是孩子！

SourceText: Dinner time isn’t going the way that {F3_DAUGHTER_4} wants. Let’s see how her mother, {F3_MOTHER}, handles her behaviour:
text: {F3_DAUGHTER_4}不好好吃饭。让我们来看看她的妈妈{F3_MOTHER}，是如何处理的：

SourceText: ▶️ Press play to learn the 5️⃣ five steps to reduce your child's negative behaviour.
text: 冬兰在处理这件事时用了哪些技巧呢？我们生活中，又该怎样处理哭闹这样的行为呢？来看看以下5️⃣点小贴士吧！

SourceText: 5️⃣ There are five steps to reduce negative, attention-seeking and demanding behaviour, such as whining or throwing tantrums.
text: 冬兰在处理这件事时用了哪些技巧呢？我们生活中，又该怎样处理哭闹这样的行为呢？来看看以下5️⃣点小贴士吧！

SourceText: 1️⃣ REDIRECT
text: 1️⃣ 转移注意力

SourceText: 🎨 Be calm, quick, clear, and positive when redirecting their attention to a positive behaviour or activity.
text: 🎨 当你想把孩子的注意力转移到积极的行为上时，要做到保持冷静、迅速转移注意力、明确指令和保持积极。

SourceText: 🌷 Praise them for this positive behaviour!
text: 🌷 记得表扬他们积极的行为！

SourceText: 2️⃣ KNOW WHAT TO IGNORE
text: 2️⃣ 知道应该对什么行为不予理睬

SourceText: 💡 Whining, demanding, showing off, tantrums, and other negative attention-seeking behaviours can be ignored. There are no bad children, only difficult behaviours!
text: 💡 你可以选择性地忽略以下行为问题：抱怨、骄纵、炫耀、发脾气，以及其他消极的寻求关注的行为等等。没有坏孩子，只有有问题的行为！

SourceText: 🚩 If we respond to negative behaviours, our children learn that this behaviour will get them attention, so they will do it again. They might also learn that if they increase their demand, they will get their way.
text: 🚩如果我们过多关注问题行为本身，孩子就会发现，这种行为能够引起注意。那么，下次他们想引起注意时，就会再次出现行为问题。他们还可能觉得，如果他们闹得越厉害，就越能够如愿以偿。

SourceText: ❗ Some behaviours that should NOT be ignored are: hitting others, coming home late, or doing something dangerous. We will learn about how to manage these behaviours in the next module.
text: ❗ 请注意，以下行为是不能忽略的：打人，很晚回家，做危险的事情。我们也将学习如何管理这类行为。

SourceText: 3️⃣ IGNORE THE BEHAVIOUR, NOT YOUR CHILD
text: 3️⃣ 选择性地忽略问题行为，而不是忽略孩子

SourceText: 🌱 When you ignore your child's behaviour (but not your child!), your child learns that the demanding behaviour will not work.
text: 🌱如果你对孩子的问题行为不予理睬（但不是忽略孩子！），孩子就会明白，闹脾气是行不通的。

SourceText: 💡 Ignoring behaviour means looking away and not talking or responding to them until they behave a different way. You should still be aware of what your child is doing.
text: 💡 当你想对某些问题行为不予理睬时，你可以看向别处，并且在孩子停止之前，坚持不做任何回应。但同时，你仍然要一直注意孩子在做什么。

SourceText: ⏰ This takes time and patience. Often your child will behave worse to get the attention. Take a pause, stay calm, and keep ignoring the behaviour.
text: ⏰这需要时间和耐心。通常情况下，为了寻求关注，孩子的问题行为会先变得更加糟糕。慢慢来，保持冷静。

SourceText: 4️⃣ PRAISE THE POSITIVE
text: 4️⃣ 表扬积极行为

SourceText: ☀️ Praise your child’s next positive behaviour.
text: ☀️表扬孩子接下来的积极行为。

SourceText: 🎈 Once your child has calmed down after showing demanding behaviour, they will need lots of love and attention on positive behaviour.
text: 🎈一旦孩子平静下来后，他们将需要大量的关爱，以及你对他们积极行为的关注。

SourceText: 🧸 You can talk later or the next day about the demanding behaviour. For now, involve your child in a positive activity.
text: 🧸你可以晚些时候或第二天，再和孩子聊聊他们的问题所在。但现在，先让他们做一些积极的活动，例如安静地玩会儿积木，或者帮你找东西，然后表扬他们！

SourceText: 5️⃣ BE CONSISTENT
text: 5️⃣ 坚持就是胜利

SourceText: ⭐ Even if your child behaves worse to get attention, it is important to continue ignoring the behaviour. Over time, your child will learn that this demanding behaviour does not work.
text: ⭐即使孩子为了获得关注而表现得更差了，你还是要坚持对他们的问题行为不予理睬。慢慢地，孩子就会知道，闹脾气是行不通的。

SourceText: 💚 Spend lots of positive time with your child - especially right after a demanding behaviour. Positive one-on-one time is super important!
text: 💚多和孩子一起做积极活动——尤其是在孩子闹脾气之后。积极的一对一亲子时光是非常重要的！

SourceText: Great! 💙 Praising our children means they are more likely to repeat this positive behaviour. Ignoring demanding behaviour can be hard, but if you are patient and give it time, it really works.
text: 真棒！💙表扬孩子做得好的地方，孩子就更愿意去这么做。孩子发脾气时，可能很难不予理睬，但耐心点，慢慢来，你会发现这真的很有效。

SourceText: That's OK! 💙 Ignoring demanding behaviour can be hard. Praising our children for positive behaviour means they are more likely to repeat it! You can always review what you learnt today in the Main Menu and build your confidence. You’ve got this!
text:
没关系！💙表扬孩子做得好的地方，孩子就更愿意去这么做。孩子发脾气时可能很难不予理睬，但耐心点，慢慢来，你会发现这真的很有效。
你可以随时在主菜单中复习今天所学的内容，渐渐地你就会熟能生巧的。你可以的！

SourceText: Skill complete! You have learnt to ignore demanding and negative, attention-seeking behaviour.
text: 达成新技能！你已经知道了如何选择性地忽略孩子的问题行为。

SourceText: You have now completed @(fields.c_n_mod_compl +1) out of @fields.c_n_mod skills towards your goal, Manage My Child’s Behaviour. ⭐
text: 你已经完成了本目标 @fields.c_n_mod 项技能中的 @(fields.c_n_mod_compl +1) 项，朝着你的目标“改善儿童行为问题”继续努力吧。⭐
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated. @results.n_skills_week and results.n_skills are numbers

SourceText: Home activity! ⭐ Find one positive thing @fields.child_nickname does today and praise them for it. If your child shows any negative, attention-seeking behaviour, redirect and if they continue, try ignoring it. Remember to ignore the behaviour, not your child!
text:
家庭练习！⭐

找出 @fields.child_nickname 今天做的好事，并表扬孩子。n
如果孩子表现出消极的、寻求关注的行为，试着转移注意力。

如果孩子还是继续，就暂时别理。

🚩记住，我们忽略的是问题行为，而不是孩子！🚩
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Can you find something to praise your child for today? ⏰
text: 今天能找个理由夸夸孩子吗？⏰

SourceText: Home activity! ⭐ Find one positive thing your child does today and praise them for it. If your child shows any negative, attention-seeking behaviour, redirect and if they continue, try ignoring it. Remember to ignore the behaviour, not your child!
text:
家庭练习！⭐

找出孩子今天做得好的事，并表扬孩子。

如果孩子表现出消极的、寻求关注的行为，试着转移注意力。

如果孩子还是继续，就暂时别理。

🚩记住，我们忽略的是问题行为，而不是孩子！🚩

SourceText: This skill is about how we can keep control and manage our anger when dealing with stressful moments. 💚
text: 压力山大时，如何保持冷静，不让愤怒情绪失控？一起走进今天的小课堂！💚

SourceText: 🌷 We love our children, but stress from caregiving and other events can make us angry. This is a normal part of life!
text: 🌷我们都爱孩子，但育儿和生活的压力，会让我们易怒。

SourceText: 💡 It is important for us to stay in control and manage our anger so we do not hurt others.
text: 💡 要学会控制怒气，才不会伤害别人和自己。

SourceText: True or False: When I am angry at my child, I should show that I am angry so that they stop misbehaving.
text: 当我生孩子气时，我应该表现出来我很生气，这样他们就不敢再犯错了。

SourceText: 💛 It can be very difficult when your child is misbehaving, but you should try to manage your own stress and control your own anger before doing anything.
text: 💛 孩子的行为可能让人抓狂，但你要先管理你自己的情绪，控制怒火

SourceText: 🌱 Taking deep breaths will help. Being angry may cause you to say or do things you will later regret.
text: 🌱 你生气时，可能会说或做出后悔的事。请深呼吸，冷静下来。

SourceText: ➡️ You can also redirect or ignore negative behaviour without ignoring your child when they are making you angry.
text: 当孩子让你生气时，可以试着转移注意力，或者选择性地不予理睬，但别忽略孩子。

SourceText: {F1_MOTHER} has her hands full and having two of her children fighting over a phone isn’t helping. Let’s see how she’s managing her anger:
text: "{F1_MOTHER}忙得不可开交，而她的两个孩子正在为了一部手机吵架，真是火上浇油。让我们来看看，她是如何控制愤怒情绪的：

SourceText: Controlling your actions in anger is not easy. 😔
text: 在愤怒中控制自己并不容易。😔

SourceText: ▶️ Press play to learn the 3️⃣ three steps to help you interact with your child in a more useful way.
text: 3️⃣个关键步骤，带你做情绪的主人，与孩子建起有效的沟通桥梁。

SourceText: 3️⃣ Practising these three steps will help you interact with your child in a more useful way.
text: 3️⃣个关键步骤，带你做情绪的主人，与孩子建起有效的沟通桥梁。

SourceText: 1️⃣ ADDRESS THE SOURCE
text: 1️⃣ 减少压力源

SourceText: 🧸 Prevent anger in the first place by making sure to sleep or rest when tired.
text: 🧸首先，为了防止愤怒情绪，请你确保自己在疲倦时能够睡上一觉，或者休息一下。

SourceText: 🍞 Have something to eat when you are hungry.
text: 🍞 确保当你觉得饿时，吃点东西。

SourceText: 💚 Ask someone for support when you are feeling alone.
text: 💚 确保当你感到孤独时，可以向别人寻求支持。

SourceText: 2️⃣ TAKE A PAUSE
text: 2️⃣ 放慢节奏

SourceText: 🌷 Slowly breathe in and out 5 times before you speak or move.
text: 🌷 在你说话或做任何行动之前，深呼吸五次。

SourceText: ☀️ Go somewhere else for 10 minutes to regain control of your emotions. A safe outdoor space is a good option!
text: ☀️ 去别的地方，比如一个安全的户外空间，待上10分钟，调节好自己的情绪。

SourceText: 3️⃣ LOOK AFTER YOURSELF
text: 3️⃣ 关爱自己

SourceText: ☕ Talk to friends, family, and other support networks everyday. We all need to connect. 💙
text: ☕ 每天与朋友、家人聊聊天。每个人都需要与外界建立联系。💙

SourceText: ❗ If you have things that can be used to hurt others, lock them up or take them out of your home.
text: ❗ 如果家里有可对他人造成伤害的东西，把它们锁起来，或者放到家外去。

SourceText: 🚗 It’s OK to have your children stay somewhere safe while you recover.
text: 🚗 在你试图恢复平静的期间，可以让孩子呆在一个安全的地方。

SourceText: Home activity! ⭐ If you start feeling angry today, breathe in and out slowly 5 times before you do anything and notice how you feel. Can you do this today? ⏰
text:
家庭练习！⭐

当你感到生气时，请在做其他事情之前，先慢慢地深呼吸5次，直到逐渐恢复平静。

你有时间试一试吗?⏰

SourceText: Great! 💙 Be proud of yourself when you manage to control your anger!
text: 太棒了！💙 你能控制住自己的愤怒情绪，太了不起了！

SourceText: That's OK! If you don't have time today, practise controlling any anger you feel tomorrow. You can practise this skill any time you start feeling angry. You are a super parent! 😃
text:
没关系！今天没空就明天试试。

任何时候生气，都可以试试这招。加油！😃

SourceText: Skill complete! You have learnt to stay in control and manage your anger when dealing with stressful situations. ✅
text: 达成新技能！你已经学会了在面对压力时，控制并管理自己的愤怒情绪。 ✅

SourceText: You have now completed @(fields.c_n_mod_compl +1) out of @fields.c_n_mod skills towards your goal, Manage my Child’s Behaviour. ⭐
text: 你已经完成了本目标 @fields.c_n_mod 项技能中的 @(fields.c_n_mod_compl +1) 项，朝着你的目标“改善儿童行为问题”继续努力吧。⭐
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated. @results.n_skills_week and results.n_skills are numbers

SourceText: Today you will learn what you can do when your child refuses to follow an instruction, forgets a family rule, or behaves in an aggressive or dangerous way… 😔
text:
你的孩子是否有时不听话、违反家规，甚至可能曾做出攻击性或危险性行为？😔

试试“后果法”吧！

SourceText: Children are still learning which actions are appropriate in different situations and which aren’t. 👀
text: 孩子们还不明白，在不同的情况下，哪些行为是合适的，哪些是不合适的。👀

SourceText: Consequences teach our children that their actions affect themselves and others. ❗
text: “后果法”能教他们，自己的行为会对自己和他人都有影响。❗

SourceText: It is important for our children to learn this as they grow. 🌱
text: 孩子成长时，要让他们明白自己行为的后果。🌱

SourceText: Giving clear consequences teaches children responsibility for their actions more than hitting or shouting does. 💙
text: 清楚地告诉孩子，他们行为会导致什么，这样能教会他们对自己的行为负责，这比打骂更有效。💙

SourceText: True or False: I can choose any consequence to give my child.
text: 我可以选择给我孩子的行为设定任何“后果”。

SourceText: It’s time to clean up from dinner and {F1_DAUGHTER_2} would rather play. Watch how her Dad, {F1_FATHER}, responds:
text: 晚饭时间到了，{F1_DAUGHTER_2}还想继续玩。看看她爸爸{F1_FATHER}是怎么运用“后果法”的：

SourceText: ▶️ Press play to learn the 4️⃣ four steps to using consequences with your child.
text: 如何像漫画中的爸爸一样有效使用“后果法”呢？看看这4️⃣个步骤吧！

SourceText: 4️⃣ Here are four simple steps for using consequences when your child behaves badly:
text: 如何像漫画中的爸爸一样有效使用“后果法”呢？看看这4️⃣个步骤吧！

SourceText: ❗ Shouting at our children only makes things worse. It also teaches them that it is okay to treat others like this when they are upset.
text: ❗ 对孩子大声喊叫只会让事情变得更糟。而且，这还会教给他们，当他们自己生气时，也可以这样去对待他人。

SourceText: 🌷 Take some deep breaths or walk away if you need to.
text: 🌷 必要时，深呼吸或离开一会儿。

SourceText: 💚 Then, respond in a calm, clear way.
text: 💚 然后，以冷静、清楚的方式作出回应。

SourceText: 2️⃣ BE FAIR
text: 2️⃣ 确保合理

SourceText: 🔄 Give a consequence connected to the behaviour. For example, if they do not clean up their toys, they cannot play with them the next day.
text: 🔄 给孩子们设定一个与此行为相关的“后果”。例如，如果他们不收拾玩具，第二天就不能玩玩具。

SourceText: 💡 Before giving a consequence, give your child the option to behave and time to do as you asked.
text: 💡 在执行“后果”之前，给孩子一个机会，让他们按照你的要求去做。

SourceText: 🔑 Make sure you can follow through with the consequence. For example, tell them they can’t play with their toys **today**, rather than for the whole week.
text: 🔑 确保你设定的“后果”是现实、合理的。例如，告诉他们“今天”不能玩玩具，而不是整个星期都不能玩。

SourceText: 👀 Notice if your child is experiencing a natural consequence for their action already. If so, you might not need to give them one. For example, if your child breaks a toy, they don't have a toy to play with. This is already a natural consequence, and you might not need to give them an additional consequence.
text: 👀 注意孩子是否已经承担了行为的自然后果。如果是这样，就不需要给他们再额外施加“后果”了。例如，如果你的孩子弄坏了玩具，他们就没得玩了。这已经是一个自然后果，不需要再给他们设定额外的“后果”。

SourceText: 🏆 Praise your child every time they do actions you want to see more of. This makes them more likely to repeat this behaviour!
text: 🏆 每当孩子表现好时，请不要吝啬你的赞美。这能让他们更有可能重复这种行为！

SourceText: 🎉 Using consequences can be hard at first, but will get easier with practice!
text: 🎉刚开始使用“后果法”时，你可能会觉得很难，但你很快就会熟能生巧的！

SourceText: ✨ Consequences help our children learn that their actions affect others - and to think before they act.
text: ✨ “后果法”能让孩子们认识到他们的行为会影响他人，所以要在行动之前三思。

SourceText: Amazing work! 🎉 You have learnt how to use fair consequences! You have now completed @(fields.c_n_mod_compl +1) out of @fields.c_n_mod skills towards your goal, Manage my Child’s Behaviour.
text: 真棒！ 🎉 你已经学会了如何合理使用“后果法”！你现在已经完成了本目标 @fields.c_n_mod 项技能中的 @(fields.c_n_mod_compl +1) 项，距离你的目标“改善儿童行为问题”又进了一步。
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated. @results.n_skills_week and results.n_skills are numbers

SourceText: 💡 It is easier for your child to follow the rule if the consequence is connected to the rule.
text: 💡 设定的“后果”要合逻辑，和行为相关。

SourceText: 📺 For example, if @fields.child_nickname doesn’t want to stop watching T.V., @fields.child_nickname won’t get to watch T.V. tomorrow.
text: 📺 例如，如果 @fields.child_nickname 一直看电视，不肯停下来，那 @fields.child_nickname 明天就不能看。
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: 📺 For example, if your child doesn’t want to stop watching T.V., your child won’t get to watch T.V. tomorrow.
text: 📺 例如，如果孩子一直看电视， 不肯停下来，那他们明天就不能看。

SourceText: ⭐ That’s correct!
text: ⭐ 答对了！

SourceText: 📺 For example, if @fields.child_nickname doesn’t want to stop watchingT.V., @fields.child_nickname won’t get to watch T.V. tomorrow.
text: 📺 例如，如果 @fields.child_nickname 一直看电视，不肯停下来，那 @fields.child_nickname 明天就不能看。
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: 📺 For example, if your child doesn’t want to stop watchingT.V., your child won’t get to watch T.V. tomorrow.
text: 📺 例如，如果孩子一直看电视， 不肯停下来，那他们明天就不能看。

SourceText: 💡 It is normal to feel uncomfortable about talking to children about abuse.
text: 💡 别不好意思跟孩子讨论侵害问题。

SourceText: ❗But there are some simple things that can help them understand when it is not OK to be touched, and what they should do if something ever happens.

SourceText: 🔑 It lets them know that they are in control of who can touch their body and in what way.

SourceText: 🌷 This prepares them to keep themselves safe throughout their lives!

SourceText: True or False: Parents should wait until their children are school-aged before talking about risks of sexual abuse.

SourceText: 🌷 It is never too early to talk with your child about how to keep them safe from sexual abuse.
text: 🌷 应该尽早和孩子谈，越早越好！

SourceText: 🧸 Even young children can learn about which parts of their body are private and which parts are public.
text: 🧸 小宝宝也能学会，哪些是隐私部位，不可以被触碰。

SourceText: 💡 They can also learn that it is important for them to tell you if anybody touches them in an inappropriate way.

SourceText: ⭐ That’s right.

text: 🚩 在大多数情况下，侵害者其实不是陌生人。他们通常是孩子或家长熟悉的人。

SourceText: ❗ They frequently form a trusting relationship with a child and initially engage in physical activities like wrestling, touching or giving a massage. This is to get the child comfortable with touch.
text: ❗ 他们经常会先跟孩子建立信任关系，然后逐渐进行触摸、按摩等肢体触碰，慢慢让孩子习惯被触碰，让孩子放松警惕。

SourceText: 🌷 It will not be as easy for the child to get away from such situations, but teaching them how to leave when they feel uncomfortable will help.
text: 🌷 逃离现场并不容易，但还是要教他们如何在感到不安时尽快离开。

SourceText: 💡 Always teach your child how to get away from any situation where they feel uncomfortable.
text: 💡 无论如何，都要教会孩子，如何在他们感到不安时，离开现场。

SourceText: 4️⃣ TELL AN ADULT
text: 4️⃣ 告诉大人

SourceText: 🔴 Tell @fields.child_nickname that if they feel worried, uncomfortable, or unsafe about anyone touching them, they should tell you or an adult they trust.

SourceText: 5️⃣ Here are five tips to help you teach your child about safe touch and what to do if they feel unsafe when someone touches them. 💛
text: 刚刚奶奶都做了些什么？

SourceText: 1️⃣ BE HONEST
text: 1️⃣ 诚实

SourceText: ✅ If @fields.child_nickname knows how their body works and where people should and should not touch them, they can make safer choices throughout their lives.
text: ✅ 如果 @fields.child_nickname 更了解自己的身体，知道别人应该和不应该触碰他们的哪些地方，那么他们在今后的生活中，就可以做出更安全、正确的选择。这将让他们受益终生！
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: 🔑 Answer any questions @fields.child_nickname has honestly. These could be about any part of their own body or that of the other sex - even private parts!
text: 🔑 如实回答 @fields.child_nickname 提出的任何问题，包括涉及他们任何身体部位的问题，以及关于异性身体部位的问题——甚至是私密部位！
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: 💚 This teaches them it is safe to ask about the body, which means they will learn more and stay safer.
text: 💚 这样孩子就能知道，可以询问任何有关身体的问题，他们也能学到更多，也会更安全。

SourceText: 👀 Teaching @fields.child_nickname about their whole body, even when young, means they will know how to talk about it if anything happens that they feel is unsafe.
text: 👀 即使孩子还很小，也要教 @fields.child_nickname 了解自己的整个身体。当发生了任何让他们感到不安的事情时，他们将会知道怎么描述。
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: ✅ If your child knows how their body works and where people should and should not touch them, they can make safer choices throughout their lives.
text: ✅ 如果孩子更了解自己的身体，知道别人应该和不应该触碰他们的哪些地方，那么他们在今后的生活中，就可以做出更安全、正确的选择。这将让他们受益终生！

SourceText: 🔑 Answer any questions your child has honestly. These could be about any part of their own body or that of the other sex - even private parts!

SourceText: 🔶 You might need to help your child talk about their feelings or redirect their focus.
text: 🔶 你可能需要引导孩子，让他们倾诉自己的感受，或转移他们的注意力。

SourceText: ➡️ You might need to talk about the actions that you or your child could take to help with what has happened.
text: ➡️ 接着，可能需要讨论你们可以采取哪些行动，来帮助解决问题。

SourceText: This skill is about learning how to keep your children safe outside the home. 🚩
text: 你平时会不会担心孩子的安全问题？ 🚩

SourceText: You are not alone! Parents all over the world say they worry about keeping their children safe. 🔔
text: 这很正常！所有父母都很担心孩子的安全。🔔

SourceText: Let’s test your knowledge about children’s safety.

SourceText: Which of these is NOT a place where children could experience harm?

SourceText: 😔 Your child could experience harm in any of these places, even at home or at school.
text: 😔 任何地方都有安全风险，包括家里和学校。

SourceText: 🌱 As caregivers, it is our job to teach them how to keep themselves safe wherever they are.
text: 🔑 教会孩子安全知识很重要！

SourceText: Let’s do a True/False Quiz! My child is always with me, so I don’t need to teach them about safety until they are older.
text: 判断对错：我一直跟孩子在一起，能保护他们，孩子还小，没必要学习安全知识。

SourceText: 💡 It’s important to teach little ones about safety early on, even if they’re always with you.
text: 💡 孩子要尽早学习安全知识，以防万一。

SourceText: 🔑 As caregivers, it is our job to help them learn how to stay safe everywhere.
⭐ You’re correct!

SourceText: 4️⃣Here are four steps to help you keep your child safe:
text: 试试这4️⃣个步骤：

SourceText: Step 1️⃣: DRAW
text: 第1️⃣步：画图

SourceText: 📝 Draw a map of areas where you live and often go.
text: 📝 画一张地图，上面包含你居住和经常去的地方。

SourceText: 🚩 Include the main places areas where you live and often go: your house, streets in your neighbourhood, pre-school, daycare, and other places
text: 🚩 里面要包括一些主要地点，比如：你的家、附近的街道、幼儿园、托育机构，以及其他你们常去的地方。

SourceText: 👋Draw and identify pictures of trusted people who @fields.child_nickname can go to when they feel unsafe. These can be you and your spouse, other family members, or teachers.
text: 👋 画出 @fields.child_nickname 可以信任的人，当孩子感到不安全时，可以去找这些人。这些人可以是你、你的爱人、其他家庭成员或老师。
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: 👋Draw and identify pictures of trusted people who your child can go to when they feel unsafe. These can be you and your spouse, other family members, or teachers.
text: 👋 画出孩子可以信任的人，当孩子感到不安全时，可以去找这些人。这些人可以是你、你的爱人、其他家庭成员或老师。

SourceText: Step 2️⃣: TALK
text: 第2️⃣步：交谈

SourceText: 🔑 Talk about the safe and unsafe places on your map. For example, let @fields.child_nickname know that the street is not a safe place, even if their toy or ball goes there.
text: 🔑 谈谈地图上哪些地方是安全的，哪些地方是不安全的。例如，让 @fields.child_nickname 知道马路上是不安全的，哪怕玩具或球掉到马路上，他们也不可以过去。
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: 🔵 CIRCLE the places that are safe for children.
text: 🔵 在对孩子来说安全的地方上画个圈。

SourceText: ❌ CROSS OFF any places that are unsafe for @fields.child_nickname. For example, areas under construction, parking areas, or unfamiliar buildings.
text: ❌ 在对 @fields.child_nickname 来说不安全的地方上画叉。例如，正在施工的区域、停车场或陌生的大楼。
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: 🔑 Talk about the safe and unsafe places on your map. For example, let your child know that the street is not a safe place, even if their toy or ball goes there.
text: 🔑 谈谈地图上哪些地方是安全的，哪些地方是不安全的。例如，让孩子知道马路上是不安全的，哪怕玩具或球掉到马路上，他们也不可以过去。

SourceText: ❌ CROSS OFF any places that are unsafe for your child. For example, areas under construction, parking areas, or unfamiliar buildings.
text: ❌ 在对孩子来说不安全的地方上画叉。例如，正在施工的区域、停车场或陌生的大楼。

SourceText: Step 3️⃣: DISCUSS
text: 第3️⃣步：讨论

SourceText: ❗ Discuss with @fields.child_nickname why it is important to ALWAYS have an adult with them when they go outside.
text: ❗ 和 @fields.child_nickname 讨论，为什么他们出门时❗ 一定❗ 要有大人陪着。
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: 🧸Make sure @fields.child_nickname knows it’s okay to walk or run awayif a stranger tries to talk to them or asks them to go somewhere.
text: 🧸要让 @fields.child_nickname 知道，如果陌生人试图和他们说话，或想带他们去某个地方，他们要赶紧跑开。
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: 👀 Discuss with @fields.child_nickname safe places they can run if a stranger approaches them – such as your home, or a neighbour’s home.
text: 👀 和 @fields.child_nickname 讨论，如果有陌生人靠近，他们可以跑去哪些安全的地方，比如自己家或者邻居家。
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: 🚩 Mark these areas clearly on your map.
text: 🚩 在地图上，把这些地方标清楚。

SourceText: ❗ Discuss with your child why it is important to ALWAYS have an adult with them when they go outside.
text: ❗ 和孩子讨论，为什么他们出门时❗ 一定❗ 要有大人陪着。

SourceText: 🧸Make sure your child knows it’s okay to walk or run awayif a stranger tries to talk to them or asks them to go somewhere.
text: 🧸要让孩子知道，如果陌生人试图和他们说话，或想带他们去某个地方，他们要赶紧跑开。

SourceText: 👀 Discuss with your child safe places they can run if a stranger approaches them – such as your home, or a neighbour’s home.
text: 👀 和孩子讨论，如果有陌生人靠近，他们可以跑去哪些安全的地方，比如自己家或者邻居家。

SourceText: Step 4️⃣: PRACTICE
text: 第4️⃣步：练习

SourceText: 🔔Practice! Practice! Practice!
text: 🔔练习！练习！练习！

SourceText: 👑 Using toys or puppets, role-play scenarios where a stranger approaches. Ask @fields.child_nickname what the toy should do. Children find it less scary to pretend that someone else is in danger.
text: 👑 用玩具或木偶进行角色扮演，假装陌生人正在靠近。问问 @fields.child_nickname ，此时这个木偶应该做什么。假装别人（而非他们自己）处于危险中，孩子就会觉得没那么可怕，不会被吓着。
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: ⭐ Praise when @fields.child_nickname chooses the correct response, such as running away, shouting for help, or finding a trusted adult.
text: ⭐ 如果 @fields.child_nickname 选择了正确的应对方式——如逃跑、大声呼救或寻找可信赖的大人，请一定要给予表扬。
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: 👑 Using toys or puppets, role-play scenarios where a stranger approaches. Ask your child what the toy should do. Children find it less scary to pretend that someone else is in danger.
text: 👑 用玩具或木偶进行角色扮演，假装陌生人正在靠近。问问孩子，此时这个木偶应该做什么。假装别人（而非他们自己）处于危险中，孩子就会觉得没那么可怕，不会被吓着。

SourceText: ⭐ Praise when your child chooses the correct response, such as running away, shouting for help, or finding a trusted adult.
text: ⭐ 如果孩子选择了正确的应对方式——如逃跑、大声呼救或寻找可信赖的大人，请一定要给予表扬。

SourceText: This skill is about learning how to keep your children safe. 🚩
text: 你平时会不会担心孩子的安全问题？ 🚩

SourceText: Let’s check in on {F3_SON_7} and his mother, {F3_MOTHER} after {F3_SON_7} finds himself in an uncomfortable situation:
text: 让我们来看看，当{F3_SON_7}遇到危险时，{F3_SON_7}和他的母亲{F3_MOTHER}是怎么做的：

SourceText: ▶️ Press Play to learn the 4️⃣ four steps to keep @fields.child_nickname safe.
text: ▶️ 和  @fields.child_nickname  试试这4️⃣个步骤：

SourceText: ▶️ Press Play to learn the 4️⃣ four steps to keep your child safe.
text: ▶️ 和孩子试试这4️⃣个步骤：

SourceText: 🚩 Include the main places: streets, your house, school, shops, and places @fields.child_nickname visits.
text: 🚩 包括主要地点：街道、你的住处、学校、商店和 @fields.child_nickname 经常去的地方。
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: 🚩 Include the main places: streets, your house, school, shops, and places your child visits.
text: 🚩 包括主要地点：街道、你的住处、学校、商店和你的孩子经常去的地方。

SourceText: 🔑 Talk about the places on your map and decide if they are safe or not.
text: 🔑 讨论地图上的地点，并确定它们是否安全。

SourceText: 👂 Listen to @fields.child_nickname: it is important to understand why they think a place is safe or unsafe.
text: 👂 听听 @fields.child_nickname 的想法，了解他们为什么认为某个地方安全或不安全，这非常重要。
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: 👂 Listen to your child: it is important to understand why they think a place is safe or unsafe.
text: 👂 听听孩子的想法，了解他们为什么认为某个地方安全或不安全，这非常重要。

SourceText: ❗ Sometimes, we find ourselves in trouble.
text: ❗ 有时候，我们会遇到麻烦。

SourceText: 👀 Discuss where you and @fields.child_nickname can get support in a crisis. These places may include home, school, a police station, or a neighbourhood committee.
text: 👀 讨论你和 @fields.child_nickname 遇到危险时，可以从哪里获得支持。这些地方可能包括家、学校、派出所或居委会。
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: 👀 Discuss where you and your child can get support in a crisis. These places may include home, school, a police station, or a neighbourhood committee.
text: 👀 讨论你和你的孩子遇到危险时，可以从哪里获得支持。这些地方可能包括家、学校、派出所或居委会。

SourceText: 👑 Role-play scenarios where a stranger approaches using toys or puppets. Ask @fields.child_nickname what the toy should do. Children find it less scary to pretend that someone else is in danger.
text: 👑 用玩具或木偶进行角色扮演，假装陌生人正在靠近。问问 @fields.child_nickname ，此时这个木偶应该做什么。假装别人（而非他们自己）处于危险中，孩子就会觉得没那么可怕，不会被吓着。
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: 👑 Role-play scenarios where a stranger approaches using toys or puppets. Ask your child what the toy should do. Children find it less scary to pretend that someone else is in danger.

text: ✨ 让孩子说一说他们自己觉得哪里不安全。

SourceText: This skill is about learning how to respond when our children are in crisis.❗
text: 孩子遇到困难时，我该怎么办❗❗

SourceText: When our children share something that is very hard or upsetting to them😔😣, we need to remember to stay calm, listen, and be open, so that they feel supported. 💛
text: 当孩子告诉家长，自己感到害怕或难过时😔😣，我们要保持冷静、耐心和开放包容，让孩子感受到爱与支持。💛

SourceText: True or False: When my child is upset, I should wait for them to come to me. I don’t want to upset them further by asking what is troubling them.
text: 当我的孩子遇到困难、感到烦闷时，我应该等孩子主动来找我，而不是我主动找他。

SourceText: 😣 When children are in crisis, they may fear telling others about it for many reasons. They may be worried about others judging them or getting angry. They may also feel shame.
text: 😣 孩子遇到困难时，可能会害怕告诉别人。

SourceText: 💚 You can ask your child very calmly about why they seem upset. 👀
text: 💚 你可以语气平和地问问孩子，最近为什么看起来闷闷不乐的。👀

SourceText: 👂 Assure them that you are proud of how brave they are to share their crisis with you.
text: 👂 让孩子知道，主动倾诉烦恼是一种勇敢的表现，你为他感到骄傲。

SourceText: 🌷 That’s right!
text: 🌷 答对了！

SourceText: {F1_SON_5} looks upset. Let’s see how his father, {F1_FATHER} responds:
text: {F1_SON_5}看起来有烦心事。我们看看他爸爸{F1_FATHER}是如何应对的：

SourceText: ▶️ Press play to learn the 4️⃣ four things you can do to support your child when they share something difficult with you.
text: ▶️ 帮助孩子学会应对困难，一定要牢记这4️⃣个关键步骤。

SourceText: 4️⃣ Here are four things you can do to support your child when they share something difficult with you:
text: 帮助孩子学会应对困难，一定要牢记这4️⃣个关键步骤。

SourceText: 1️⃣ BREATHE: Take a pause
text: 1️⃣ 深呼吸：暂停一下。

SourceText: 🌱 Take a deep breath so you can respond calmly.
text: 🌱 深呼吸，保持心平气和。

SourceText: 💛 Ask yourself, “What does my child need right now?”
text: 💛 问自己：“我的孩子现在最需要什么？”

SourceText: 2️⃣ LISTEN: Ask your child what is going on
text: 2️⃣ 倾听：问问孩子发生了什么事

SourceText: 👂 Let your child share with you what they need. Sometimes, your child might be comfortable sharing by drawing.
text: 👂让孩子说出自己的需要，通过口头表达或者画画都可以。

SourceText: 👀 Notice what they are feeling and tell them what you notice so they feel heard.
text: 👀对孩子的感受表示理解。

SourceText: 💙 Tell your child that you are there for them and love them.
text: 💙告诉孩子不管发生什么事，你都会一直陪伴在他身边。

SourceText: 😣Both girls AND boys could face hard times and crisis situations. Remember to check-in with both.
text: 😣无论男孩还是女孩，都可能面临困难和危机，都需要你的关注和支持。

SourceText: 4️⃣ COMFORT: Be there for your child
text: 4️⃣ 安慰：陪伴孩子

SourceText: 🌷 It can be hard to see your child feeling upset or confused, but there is a lot you can do to support them.
text: 🌷孩子感到不安或迷茫时，你可以提供很多帮助。

SourceText: 💚 They need you to accept them and comfort them when difficult things are going on.
text: 💚在困难面前，孩子需要你接纳和安慰他。

SourceText: 🔄In these moments, maintaining a consistent routine can be particularly helpful. Familiar routines can provide a sense of security and normalcy, helping your child feel safe again.
text: 🔄让孩子保持熟悉的作息规律，尽快恢复日常生活，安抚孩子的不安情绪。

SourceText: 🎈 Remind your child again that you love them, and thank them for sharing with you.
text: 🎈经常提醒孩子你爱他，谢谢他愿意向你倾诉心声。

SourceText: Amazing job! 🎉 You have completed the Respond to Crises skill! You have now completed @(fields.c_n_mod_compl +1) out of @fields.c_n_mod skills towards your goal, Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.
text: 太棒了！🎉你已经学完了应对危机技能！你已经完成了 @fields.c_n_mod 项技能中的 @(fields.c_n_mod_compl +1) 项，向实现“保障儿童安全健康”目标又迈进了一步。
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated. @results.n_skills_week and results.n_skills are numbers

SourceText: 3️⃣ RESPOND: What might help what is going on?
text: 3️⃣ 回应：怎样帮孩子解决问题？

SourceText: ⏸ You can teach @fields.child_nickname consequences if needed. In the moment, your child needs you to be there for them with love.
text: ⏸可以告诉 @fields.child_nickname 后果是什么。这种时候，孩子比平时更需要你的爱和陪伴。

SourceText: ⏸ You can teach your child consequences if needed. In the moment, your child needs you to be there for them with love.
text: ⏸如果需要，你可以告诉孩子后果是什么。在这种时候，你更需要带着爱陪伴在他们身边。

SourceText: Children are spending a lot of time online. ⏰
Being connected helps them stay positive and learn more! 🔑
text: 孩子们现在花很长时间上网。🔑

SourceText: But there are also some risks and dangers. 🚩
text: 网络能帮助学习新东西，但也存在风险，需要家长引导！🚩

SourceText: True or False: Parents should set time limits on how long their child can use the internet each day.
text: 家长应该限制孩子每天上网的时间。

SourceText: One more! True or false: It is safe for young children to have their social media accounts without parental supervision.
text:
再来一道判断题：

在没有家长监督的情况下，孩子可以自己使用社交媒体。

SourceText: 🔑 Social media platforms have age restrictions for a reason.
text: 🔑 社交媒体通常有年龄限制。

SourceText: 👀 Young children should not have social media accounts without parental guidance and supervision, as they may encounter inappropriate content or interactions.
text: 👀 儿童不应该在缺乏成年人监督的情况下，自行使用社交媒体。

SourceText: ⭐ Correct!
text: ⭐ 答对了！

SourceText: 🔑 Social media platforms have age restrictions for a reason.
text: 🔑 社交平台通常有年龄限制。

SourceText: {F3_DAUGHTER_4} wants to watch videos on the handphone. Her mother, {F3_MOTHER}, uses this opportunity to teach {F3_DAUGHTER_4} about how to stay safe online:
text: {F3_DAUGHTER_4}想用手机玩游戏、看视频。看看她妈妈{F3_MOTHER}是如何教{F3_DAUGHTER_4}安全上网的：

SourceText: 1️⃣ LEARN the dangers of being online:
text: 1️⃣ 了解网络上可能存在的危险：

SourceText: 🚩 CONTENT: Your child might come across harmful content, such as violence, hateful speech, pornography, wrong information, or hating women, people with disabilities, or other races, religions, sexualities, or from other countries.
text: 🚩内容：你的孩子可能会接触到有害内容，比如暴力、色情、违法信息等。

SourceText: 🚩 CONTACT: Adults might pretend to be children and ask for sexual pictures or to meet with your child through an online platform.
text: 🚩 交际：成人可能会假扮成儿童，引诱孩子提供个人照片、家庭住址等敏感信息，或者与孩子视频聊天。

SourceText: 🚩 CONDUCT: Sometimes, children or strangers can say or do hurtful things online.
text: 🚩 行为：其他孩子或陌生人可能会在网上有错误的言论或者行为。

SourceText: 2️⃣ PROTECT - Keep your child safe online
text: 2️⃣ 保护孩子安全上网

SourceText: ✅ Talk to your child about which apps and websites are safe and which are not. Discuss why!
text: ✅ 告诉孩子哪些应用和网站是安全的，哪些是不安全的，讲解原因。

SourceText: ✅ Help your child learn how to make strong passwords to protect their devices.
text: ✅ 帮孩子学习如何设置强效密码，保护他们的电子设备或账号。

SourceText: ✅ Tell your child that they should keep personal information private including photos or videos of themselves. What goes online, stays online!
text: ✅ 告诉孩子对于照片视频和家庭情况信息等涉及隐私的内容，不要轻易发到网上，当心被窃取或利用。

SourceText: That’s great! Helping your child stay safe online is important so they can learn and connect with others. Well done for getting involved. They will be safer for it! 🔑
text: 太棒了！网络空间也存在危险，帮助孩子安全上网很重要🔑

SourceText: That’s OK. Put some time aside this week to do this activity with your child. ⏰ It’s important to talk to our children about how to stay safe online so they can use the digital world to learn more and connect with others. You can do this! ⭐
text:
没关系。请在这周抽个时间，和孩子一起聊聊怎么安全上网吧。⏰
加油，你可以的！⭐

SourceText: Amazing! 🎉 You have learnt how to keep your child safe online. You have completed @(fields.c_n_mod_compl +1) out of @fields.c_n_mod skills in the Keep My Child Safe & Healthy!
text: 真棒！🎉你已经学会了如何让孩子安全上网！在“保障孩子安全健康”这个目标模块中，你已经完成了 @fields.c_n_mod 项技能中的 @(fields.c_n_mod_compl +1) 项。
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated. @results.n_skills_week and results.n_skills are numbers

SourceText: This skill is about how to keep @fields.child_nickname safe online. 📱
text: @fields.child_nickname 每天都上网，但是网络世界真的安全吗？📱
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: There is so much to share. We will cover online safety over two lessons. 2️⃣
text: 我们将用2️⃣节课来聊一聊，如何保证孩子上网安全。

SourceText: This skill is about how to keep your child safe online. 📱
text: 孩子每天都上网，但是网络世界真的安全吗？📱

SourceText: 🎉 Correct!
text: 🎉 答对了！

SourceText: ⏰ Setting time limits can help balance online activities with other important tasks, such as homework, physical activities, and other tasks.
text: ⏰ 限定上网时间，可以确保孩子有充足时间做其他重要的事情，减少屏幕时间！

SourceText: 💡 If your child encounters something distressing or inappropriate online, they should tell you immediately so you can address the issue and get support if needed.

SourceText: Keeping @fields.child_nickname safe online is an important step to help them be part of the digital world. 📱

SourceText: We are going to learn 4️⃣ ways to keep your child safe online:
text: 我们将学习4️⃣种方法来确保孩子安全上网：

SourceText: 1️⃣ LEARN
text: 1️⃣ 了解危险

SourceText: 2️⃣ PROTECT

SourceText: Keeping your child safe online is an important step to help them be part of the digital world. 📱
text: 保证孩子安全上网，是帮助他们适应信息化社会的重要一步。📱

SourceText: Here are 4️⃣ tips that can help keep your child safe online:
text: 确保孩子安全上网，要做到这4️⃣点：

SourceText: 🔑 Today, we are learning about LEARN and PROTECT.
text: 🔑 这节课我们先学习前两种方法：“了解危险”和“提供保护”。

SourceText: Ask your child what they do to stay safe online. 👂 You may find that they are already thinking about online safety. 💡
text:
问问孩子，他是如何注意上网安全的？👂
记得表扬孩子为安全上网所做的任何努力！💡

SourceText: Praise your child for any efforts they make. Can you talk with @fields.child_nickname today? 🔔
text: 你今天能和 @fields.child_nickname 聊聊这个话题吗？🔔
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Praise your child for any efforts they make. Can you talk with your child today? 🔔
text: 你今天能和孩子聊聊这个话题吗？🔔

SourceText: This skill continues our learning about keeping our children safe online. 📱
text: 今天我们继续学习，如何保证孩子安全上网。📱

SourceText: The previous lesson taught you ways to protect your child online with 1️⃣ LEARN and 2️⃣ PROTECT. 🔑
text:
帮助孩子安全上网有4️⃣种方法，你还记得吗？
上一节课，我们学习了“了解危险”和“提供保护”。🔑

SourceText: In this skill, we will learn how to 3️⃣ BUILD HABITS and 4️⃣ BUILD TRUST. ✨
text: 今天我们将学习后两种方法：“养成习惯”和“建立信任”。✨

SourceText: 💡 Often, our children understand more about life online than we do, but that does not mean they know how to keep safe.
text: 💡通常，我们的孩子比我们更了解网络，但这并不意味着他们知道如何确保安全上网。

SourceText: ⭐ Let’s test your online safety knowledge.
text: ⭐ 让我们来测试一下你的安全上网知识吧。

SourceText: True or False: If I send a picture to a friend, it will only be visible to them.
text: 判断对错：我在网上给好友发送的图片，只有好友本人能看到，别人都看不到。

SourceText: ❌ That’s incorrect.
text: ❌ 并不是这样。

SourceText: 📱 Even in an app where images are temporary, your friend can capture their screen and save your image.
text: 📱 你的好友可以通过截屏来保存或传播你的图片。

SourceText: 🚩 Pictures are always stored online and can be accessed by hackers.
text: 🚩 你发的照片会一直留在网上，也可能会被黑客盗取。

SourceText: ❗ What goes online, stays online!
text: ❗ 不仅是照片，你发到网上的所有东西都会留在网上！

SourceText: My password is strong because you have to know my birthday to guess it.
text: 判断对错：我的密码很难猜，你必须知道我的生日才能猜出来。

SourceText: ❗ Most passwords are hacked because someone accesses a list of home addresses, birth dates, names or phone numbers.
text: ❗ 大多数密码之所以能够被破解，就是因为包含了家庭住址、出生日期、姓名、电话号码等个人信息，而这些信息很容易被泄露。

SourceText: 🚩 You should never use these details in your password as they are easily guessed.
text: 🚩 设置密码时，请不要使用这些个人信息。

SourceText: ✨ That’s correct.
text: ✨ 答对了！

SourceText: Links sent to me by my family and friends are safe to click on.
text: 判断对错：我的家人朋友发给我的链接都是安全的。

SourceText: ❗ Your family member’s email or phone account could be hacked.
text: ❗ 家人朋友的社交账号也可能会被盗。

SourceText: 👀 Always double-check a link before clicking on it to make sure you’re visiting a trusted website.
text: 👀 在点击一个网址或链接之前，一定要仔细检查一下，确保你访问的网址是可信的。

SourceText: 🔑 If you don’t recognize the web address, don’t click on it.
text: 🔑 如果这是一个陌生的网址，就不要打开它。

SourceText: 🎈 That’s right!
text: 🎈 答对了！

SourceText: 3️⃣ BUILD HABITS. Set up safe online habits at home:
text: 3️⃣ 养成习惯，即在家养成安全上网的习惯：

SourceText: ❌📱 Plan phone-free times in your house, like during meals, homework, or in bed.
text: ❌📱在家里规定哪些时间不能用手机，比如吃饭、做作业或睡觉的时候。

SourceText: ⭐ Only let your child chat online with people they already know. They should never share personal information in a chat room or with strangers.
text: ⭐只允许孩子在网上和他们在现实中认识的人聊天，而不能与陌生人聊天，或分享个人信息。

SourceText: 👀 Before completing forms that ask for personal information, check that the web address begins with https://. Websites that begin with http:// may not be secure.
text: 👀在填写表格、提供个人信息之前，请检查网址是否以https://开头。以http://开头的网站可能不安全。

SourceText: 📝 For older children, you can help them create strong passwords for their accounts. They should be long, not include obvious personal information like your name or birthday, and include upper and lower case letters, numbers and symbols.
text: 📝对于年龄较大的孩子，你可以帮他们给自己的账号设定较复杂的密码。密码应该长一些，不要包含明显的个人信息，比如名字或生日。密码还应同时包括大小写字母、数字和符号。

SourceText: ❗ Tell your child not to click on pop-ups that ask them to download or pay for anything.
text: ❗告诉孩子不要点击任何下载链接或付费弹窗。

SourceText: 🌷 Together, look at websites, social media, games, and apps your child uses.
text: 🌷和孩子一起看看他们访问的网站、社交媒体、游戏和软件。

SourceText: 👂 Ask questions - this helps you learn more about your child’s interests!
text: 👂向他们提问——这可以帮助你进一步了解孩子的兴趣！

SourceText: 💙 If you come across anything worrying together, talk about it with your child.
text: 💙如果你们看到了什么令人担忧的事，就开诚布公地聊聊。

SourceText: ✅ Tell your child that they should tell an adult if they feel scared, unsafe or upset about something online.
text: ✅告诉孩子，如果他们对网上的东西感到害怕、不安，他们应该立即告诉大人。

SourceText: Here are some steps you can take to keep your child safe online today:
text:
家庭练习！⭐ 
你今天可以尝试做这些事，来保证孩子的上网安全：

SourceText: 📝 Have a conversation with your child about how they can use the internet and devices in a safe way.
text: 📝 和你的孩子谈谈如何安全地使用互联网和电子设备。

SourceText: 🔴 Talk about which sites or apps might be unsafe. Why?
text: 🔴 讨论哪些网站或应用程序可能不安全。为什么？

SourceText: 😃 Praise your child for how good they are at using the web!
text: 😃 赞美你的孩子能很好使用网络的能力！

SourceText: Can you and your child complete this task today? 🔔
text: 你和孩子今天能试一试吗？🔔

SourceText: Amazing! 🎉 You have learnt how to keep your child safe online. You have completed @(fields.c_n_mod_compl +1) out of @fields.c_n_mod skills in Keep My Child Safe and Healthy!
text: 真棒！🎉你已经学会了如何让孩子安全上网！在“保障孩子安全健康”这个目标模块中，你已经完成了 @fields.c_n_mod 项技能中的 @(fields.c_n_mod_compl +1) 项。
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated. @results.n_skills_week and results.n_skills are numbers

SourceText: Keeping @fields.child_nickname safe online is an important step to help them be part of the digital world. 📱

SourceText: Here’s a 2nd video learning how to 3️⃣ BUILD HABITS and 4️⃣ BUILD TRUST.

SourceText: Keeping your child safe online is an important step to help them be part of the digital world. 📱
text: 保证孩子安全上网，是帮助他们适应信息化社会的重要一步。📱

SourceText: Today, we are learning how to 3️⃣ BUILD HABITS and 4️⃣ BUILD TRUST.
text: 今天，我们学习如何3️⃣ 养成习惯和4️⃣ 建立信任。

SourceText: This skill is about encouraging our children to eat nutritious food and practise healthy eating habits. 🍚
text: 今天来学学，如何帮孩子养成健康的饮食习惯吧！🍚

SourceText: Children are exposed to various food items in their lives. 🎂🍜
text: 孩子们会接触到各种食物。🎂🍜

SourceText: Some of them are good for children’s development, while others are not. 🍅
text: 不是所有食物都有益于儿童发展哦。🍅

SourceText: In the early years, children can be trained at home to eat balanced and nutritious meals in moderate amounts. 🍚
text: 孩子的饮食应该是什么样的？🍚

SourceText: Our children need the support of parents to practise healthy eating habits from a young age 💛
text: 应该是：适量、均衡、营养丰富的！💛

SourceText: True or False: Eating unhealthy food will not influence how your child behaves
text: 判断对错：吃不健康的食物并不会影响到孩子的行为表现。

SourceText: 😣 Eating too much sugary and junk food may make your child feel cranky.
text: 😣 吃太多垃圾食品，会让孩子变得易怒。

SourceText: 🍅Healthy foods like fruits, veggies, and whole grains are good for your child’s body, brain, AND behaviour. This can improve their thinking, focus, and mood.
text: 🍅 水果、蔬菜和谷物，则对孩子的身体、大脑和行为都有好处。

SourceText: {F1_DAUGHTER_6} only wants snacks but not vegetables. Let’s see how her mother, {F1_MOTHER}, responds.
text: {F1_DAUGHTER_6}只想吃零食，不想吃蔬菜，她妈妈{F1_MOTHER}要如何应对呢？

SourceText: Teaching our children healthy eating habits from a young age helps them make healthy choices as they grow older.💙😃🍚
▶️ Press play to learn 4️⃣ four ways to help your child make healthy choices.
text:
到底该如何培养孩子良好的饮食习惯呢？💙🍚

快来看看4️⃣个小贴士吧！

SourceText: 4️⃣ Here are four tips you can use to support your child with healthy eating:
text: 快来看看4️⃣个小贴士吧！

SourceText: That's OK! If you don't have time today, set some time aside tomorrow to talk about making healthy choices. Remember to praise them when they do it! You are a super parent! 😃
text: 没关系。那就明天再找时间试试！当孩子选择了健康的食物，别忘了表扬他们😃

SourceText: 1️⃣ A BIT OF EVERYTHING
text: 1️⃣ 什么都吃点

SourceText: Allow @fields.child_nickname to enjoy a variety of food in moderation. Every day, make sure they have:
text: 让 @fields.child_nickname 适量摄入多种多样的食物。每天，确保他们要吃：
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: 🍚 2-3 servings of carbohydrates
text: 🍚 两到三份碳水化合物

SourceText: 1 serving: 2 spoons of rice or similar amount of noodle
text: 一份相当于：两勺米饭或等量的面条。

SourceText: 🍅 3-4 servings of fruits and vegetables
text: 🍅 三到四份水果蔬菜。

SourceText: 1 serving: a small plate of vegetables or 1 medium-sized fruit
text: 一份相当于：一小盘蔬菜或一个中等大小的水果。

SourceText: 💚 1-2 servings of dairy products and protein
text: 💚 一到两份奶制品或蛋白质。

SourceText: 1 serving: 1 chicken thigh, 1 egg or 1 glass of milk
text: 一份相当于：一只鸡腿、一颗鸡蛋或一杯牛奶

SourceText: 🚩 Just a little bit of oil, fat, processed sugar, and salt
text: 🚩 每天只需一点点油、脂肪、糖和盐

SourceText: Allow your child to enjoy a variety of food in moderation. Every day, make sure they have:
text: 让孩子适量摄入多种多样的食物。每天，确保他们要吃：

SourceText: 2️⃣ MANAGE EMOTIONS
text: 2️⃣ 管理情绪

SourceText: 🌷 Sometimes, @fields.child_nickname may start whining for unhealthy food choices. Take a deep breath and stay calm.
text: 🌷 有时， @fields.child_nickname 可能会哭闹着想吃不健康的食物。深呼吸，保持冷静。
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: ➡️ Try redirecting @fields.child_nickname’s attention to healthier food options, and then ignoring @fields.child_nickname’s demanding behaviour if they continue.
text: ➡️ 试试把 @fields.child_nickname 的注意力转移到更健康的食物上来。如果 @fields.child_nickname 还继续哭闹，暂时别理会他们。
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: 🏅 Praise or reward @fields.child_nickname for choosing healthy foods.
text: 🏅 如果 @fields.child_nickname 主动选择了健康食物，记得表扬或奖励孩子。
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: 🎈 You should give yourself a treat too, for successfully teaching @fields.child_nickname to make healthy choices!
text: 🎈你也应该犒劳一下自己，因为你教会了 @fields.child_nickname 选择健康的食物！
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: 🌷 Sometimes, your child may start whining for unhealthy food choices. Take a deep breath and stay calm.
text: 🌷 有时，你的孩子可能会哭闹着想吃不健康的食物。深呼吸，保持冷静。

SourceText: ➡️ Try redirecting your child’s attention to healthier food options, and then ignoring your child’s demanding behaviour if they continue.
text: ➡️ 试试把孩子的注意力转移到更健康的食物上来。如果孩子还继续哭闹，暂时别理会他们。

SourceText: 🏅 Praise or reward your child for choosing healthy foods.
text: 🏅 如果孩子主动选择了健康食物，记得表扬或奖励他们。

SourceText: 🎈 You should give yourself a treat too, for successfully teaching your child to make healthy choices!
text: 🎈 你也应该犒劳一下自己，因为你教会了孩子健康饮食！

SourceText: 3️⃣ LISTEN TO YOUR CHILD
text: 3️⃣ 听听孩子怎么说

SourceText: 👂 Listen to @fields.child_nickname when they say they are hungry or full.
text: 👂 当 @fields.child_nickname 说饿了或者饱了的时候，要当回事。
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: 💡 Depending on @fields.child_nickname’s activities for the day, @fields.child_nickname may require less or more food.
text: 💡  @fields.child_nickname 每天吃多少，也会随着 @fields.child_nickname 一天的活动量而变化。
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: 💚 If @fields.child_nickname always seems hungry or full, a doctor can help to figure out why.
text: 💚 如果 @fields.child_nickname 总是感觉很饿或很饱，最好去听听医生的建议。
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: 🍜 @fields.child_nickname will also observe and learn from the eating habits of people around them. Make healthy food choices as a family to teach @fields.child_nickname to do the same.
text: 🍜 @fields.child_nickname 也会观察和学习周围人的饮食习惯。大家应该一起选择健康饮食，这样能为 @fields.child_nickname 树立榜样。
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: 👂 Listen to your child when they say they are hungry or full.
text: 👂 当孩子说饿了或者饱了的时候，要当回事。

SourceText: 💡 Depending on your child’s activities for the day, your child may require less or more food.
text: 💡孩子每天吃多少，也会随着他们一天的活动量而变化。

SourceText: 💚 If your child always seems hungry or full, a doctor can help to figure out why.
text: 💚 如果你的孩子总是感觉很饿或很饱，最好去听听医生的建议。

SourceText: 🍜 your child will also observe and learn from the eating habits of people around them. Make healthy food choices as a family to teach your child to do the same.
text: 🍜 孩子也会观察和学习周围人的饮食习惯。大家应该一起选择健康饮食，这样能为孩子树立榜样。

SourceText: 4️⃣ KEEP IT CLEAN
text: 4️⃣ 保持卫生

SourceText: 💙 Preparing food with love is important for @fields.child_nickname. It is also important to be clean while making food and drinks.
text: 💙 在准备和制作食物的过程中保持干净卫生，这有益于 @fields.child_nickname 的健康。
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: ✨ Wash your hands before touching food items or feeding @fields.child_nickname.
text: ✨在接触食物或喂 @fields.child_nickname 吃饭前，一定要记得洗手。
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: 💡 Wash fresh food items before cooking them.
text: 💡 做饭前要把食材清洗干净。

SourceText: ☀️ Hot weather makes many food types go bad very fast. It is best to store food in airtight containers or the fridge so they stay fresh.
text: ☀️ 许多食物在天气炎热时变质得很快。最好将食物储存在密封容器或冰箱中，这样可以保持新鲜。

SourceText: ⭐ Keep the kitchen, fridge, cutlery, and table tops clean from dust, insects, and house lizards.
text: ⭐ 保持厨房、冰箱、餐具和桌面洁净，防止灰尘和昆虫。

SourceText: 💙 Preparing food with love is important for your child. It is also important to be clean while making food and drinks.
text: 💙 在准备食物的过程中应保持干净卫生

SourceText: ✨ Wash your hands before touching food items or feeding your child.
text: ✨在接触食物或喂孩子吃饭前，一定记得要洗手。
